definition: (visitor, tour, audio etc) guide/guided tour/(site) navigator/to guide
to transmit/to lead/to guide/to conduct/to direct

pinyin: shu4 zi4 dao3 lan3 she4 shi1

sentences.english: Do you have an audio guide?
I guide tourists to attractions around Kaohsiung.
sentences.chinese: 我爲觀光客導覽高雄的景點。

sentences.english: We only had the bus and guide for three hours, so were taking a panoramic view of Rome.
sentences.chinese: 我們只有這班公車及三個小時的導覽來一窺羅馬全景。

sentences.english: Ecological tour guide in Yang-ming-shan National Park.
sentences.chinese: 陽明山國家公園生態導覽。

sentences.english: A quarterly trade title features full color, large-format illustrations of brand name watches gleaned from around the world.
sentences.chinese: 名錶時尚季刊，薈萃環球知名流行品牌，爲市場導覽。

sentences.english: Allows administrators to customize the site navigation menu.
sentences.chinese: 允許管理者自訂網站導覽選單。

sentences.english: You can even join a free, 60-minute guided tour of the collection every day at 11.30am and 2.30pm.
sentences.chinese: 你還可以加入一場長達一小時的免費作品導覽。

definition: to seek by inquiry or search/to call on/to visit
to look at sth with pleasure/to watch (sth marvelous)/ornamental
shuttle bus ferrying passengers between train stations on two different rail lines
site developed for a group of related enterprises/(industrial or technology) park
conferences and exhibitions, abbr. of 會議展覽|会议展览[hui4 yi4 zhan3 lan3]
student/member of an institution of learning/officer cadet
Pingtung city, county and military airbase in south Taiwan
